input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a children "item" (to support multiple item support, we give "item" multiple times), which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Create Incident
This wrapper creates 'Incident' record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-incident</operation-name> <model> <keys> <incident-i-d> <value>MyIncident0021</value> <type>String</type> </incident-i-d> </keys> <instance>
<resolution-fix-type> <value>permanent</value> <type>String</type> </resolution-fix-type>
<incident-i-d> <value>MyIncident0021</value> <type>String</type> </incident-i-d> <category> <value>telecoms</value> <type>String</type> </category> <open-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </open-time> <opened-by> <value>opened by</value> <type>String</type> </opened-by> <severity> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </severity> <updated-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </updated-time> <primary-assignment-group> <value>CLIENT SECURITY</value> <type>String</type> </primary-assignment-group> <closed-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </closed-time> <closed-by> <value>closed by</value> <type>String</type> </closed-by> <closure-code> <value>0</value> <type>String</type> </closure-code> <configuration-item> <value>Exchange C</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <incident-description> <type>Array</type> <incident-description> <element> <value>incident description line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>incident description line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </incident-description> </incident-description> <resolution> <type>Array</type> <resolution> <element> <value>reslolution line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>resolution line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </resolution> </resolution> <assignee-name> <value>CLIENT SECURITY 1</value> <type>String</type> </assignee-name> <contact> <value>THOMPSON, TERESA</value> <type>String</type> </contact> <journal-updates> <type>Array</type> <journal-updates> <element> <value>journal updates line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>journal update line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </journal-updates> </journal-updates> <alert-status> <value>alert status</value> <type>String</type> </alert-status> <contact-last-name> <value>contact last name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-last-name> <contact-first-name> <value>contact first name</value> <type>String</type> </contact-first-name> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <brief-description> <value>brief description</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <ticket-owner> <value>ticket owner</value> <type>String</type> </ticket-owner> <updated-by> <value>updated by</value> <type>String</type> </updated-by> <IMTicket-status> <value>IMTicket status</value> <type>String</type> </IMTicket-status> <subcategory> <value>fixed infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <SLAAgreement-i-d> <value>145</value> <type>Decimal</type> </SLAAgreement-i-d> <site-category> <value>site category</value> <type>String</type> </site-category> <product-type> <value>fixed infrastructure</value> <type>String</type> </product-type> <problem-type> <value>none</value> <type>String</type> </problem-type>
<user-priority> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </user-priority> <solution> <type>Array</type> <solution> <element> <value>solution line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>solution line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </solution> </solution> <initial-impact> <value>2</value> <type>String</type> </initial-impact>
<s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <value>45</value> <type>Decimal</type> </s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <i-m-ticket-status> <value>i m ticket status</value> <type>String</type> </i-m-ticket-status> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
The elements provided in the instance element refer to particular field of the record. We create an instance of this record by providing information in the <value> elements.
NOTE: The elements provided in <keys> element doesn’t mean that we are asking the application that these elements (the elements in the <keys> element) should be treated as keys for the record being created. Application has pre-defined key elements. The elements given in the <keys> element are meaning-less.
Complete Elements’ Description:
NOTE: The element <incident-i-d> is used as key. Thus this field must be populated with unique string. Or let the server choose an auto-generated key for the record.
Quick Reference list of Required elements: <category>, <severity>, <primary-assignment-group>, <incident-description>, <contact>, <subcategory>, <site-category>, <product-type>, <problem-type> and <initial-impact> a total of 10 elements.
Item [Required]:
This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
Operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-incident</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Resolution-fix-type [Optional]: To keep information whether the resolution fixed type is permanent or temporary.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden normally. When we close the record, this field gets exposed (as radio button) at location Activities > Action/Resolution > Fix Type.
Valid Values: permanent, temporary
Default Value: This field is necessary when we make chenges.
Incident-i-d [Optional]: The ID of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Number (Header Information.)
Valid Values: Any unique string.
Default Value: Auto generated an unique string.
Category [Required]: The category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Category.
Valid Values: telecoms shared infrastructure security printing other network service catalog enquiry client system change busyness applications
Default Value: No Default value, it's required field.
Open-time [Optional]: The date-time when the record was opened.
Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (At)
Valid Values: Any input in the DateTime format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: Auto generated current date-time.
Opened-by [Optional]: The person, opening the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (By)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: the user of web-service (e.g., falcon)
Severity [Required]: The severity (urgency) of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Detail > Urgency.
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4 1 -> Critical, 2 -> high, 3 -> average, 4 ->low
Default Value: It's a required field, and thus no default.
Updated-time[Optional]: The time at which update (last) was done.
Name of this field in the application: History > Last Update (At)
Valid Values: Any Input in DateTime format.
Valid Values: any input in date time format. The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: The hp-service center server maintains this field.
Note: One should not try to populate/update this field. The hp-service center server maintains this field itself. In fact, one can't populate/modify it (it's read only field.) However, one can use this field during retrieving.
Primary-assignment-group [Required]: the primary assignment group.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Primary Asgn Group.
Valid Values:
AUTO CLIENT SECURITY DEFAULT FACILITIES FIELD ENG. HELPDESK LAN SUPPORT M/F SUPPORT ONSITE SUPPORT PROCUREMENT SECONDLINE SERVICE DESK SOFTWARE SYSTEMS ADMIN SYSTEMS SUPPORT TELECOMS TRAINING WAN SUPPORT
Default Value: it's a mandatory field, thus no default.
closed-time [Optional]: the date when the record was closed.
Name of this element in the application: History > Closed (At)
Valid Values: any input in date time format. The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”, if the record was not closed. But if it was updated, then hp-service-center server will maintain the field according to its date-time.
closed-by [Optional]: the person closing the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > closed (By)
Valid Vales: Any string.
Default Value: the user of web-service (e.g., falcon)
closure-code [Optional]: The close code.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string, especially string in numeral form. For example 123.
Default Value: application sets this value.
Note: This field is maintained by the application. When a record is closed then application populate this field according to success/failure (there might be many category of failure, and corresponding code is set by the application for later user. This code is normally used while debugging/processing the response.)
configuration-item [Optional]: The configuration item (defected) for which the incident was raised.
Name of this element in the application: Associated CI > Configuration Item.
Valid Values: Any existing configuration item.
Default Value: This field gets populated according to associated default configuration item to <contact>. Note this field (<contact>) is required field, and you must have to provide any existing/valid contact.
Location[Optional]: The location information for the configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Associated CI > Location.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: This field gets populated according the location information information provided in the selected configuration item.
Note: Essentially, this field is populated according to location information provided in the configuration item selected. So, directly (during the creation of the incident record), user don't have control over this field to populate/modify this field with random string.
incident-description [Required]: The description to the incident. Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Required]: each element shows one line of incident-description field.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Incident Description.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: One must have to enter at least one line (one <element> of the item xml.)
resolution [Optional]: The resolution information (description that was entered after resolving the issue.) Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of resolution field.
Name of this element in the application: Activities > Action/Resolution > Solution.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: “”
assignee-name [Optional]: The name of assignee.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Assignee Name.
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any pre-existing contact record (provided the assignee-name is member of primary assignment group (<primary-assignment-group>)).
(Note, however the application don’t raise any problem when we create any record with assignee name which is not a member of primary assignment group. Maybe API issue!!.)
Default Value: “”
contact [Required]: The contact person.
Name of this element int the application: Incident Details > Reported By (while creating the record from hp-service center client UI.) Contact > Contact (On created record.)
Valid Values: Any valid/existing contact record.
Default Value: “”
journal-updates [Optional] : The journal updates' description. Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: Each element shows one line of 'journal-update' field.
Name of this element in the application: Activities > Journal Updates.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Values: “”
alert-status [Optional]: The alert status.
Name of the element in the application: Incident Category > Alert Status (see at left top corner.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: Application maintains this field according to the status of the ticket, like “open”, “closed”, “updated” etc. In case it the record was firstly created, this field gets populated with value “open”.
contact-last-name[Optional]: The contact person's last name.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Full Name (second column)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: This field gets populated according to the 'Name' information information provided in the selected <contact>. Note, this <contact> element is required element.
Note: Essentially, this field is populated according to the 'Name' information provided in the selected <contact>. So, directly (during the creation of the incident record), user don't have control over this field to populate/modify this field with random string.
Contact-first-name [Optional]: The contact person's first name.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Full Name (first column.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: This field gets populated according to the 'Name' information information provided in the selected <contact>. Note, this <contact> element is required element.
Note: Essentially, this field is populated according to the 'Name' information provided in the selected <contact>. So, directly (during the creation of the incident record), user don't have control over this field to populate/modify this field with random string.
Company [Optional] : The company information.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Company.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: This field gets populated according to the 'Company' information provided in the selected <contact>. Note, this <contact> element is required element.
Note: Essentially, this field is populated according to the 'Company' information provided in the selected <contact>. So, directly (during the creation of the record), user don't have control over this field to populate/modify this field with random string.
Brief-description [Optional]: The brief description of the indent record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Title (Header Information.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
ticket-owner [Optional] : The ticket (incident record) owner.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Owner (see at right top corner.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: The web-server user (e.g., falcon.)
Note: This field can't be populated/modified from hp-service-center client user interface application.
Updated-by [Optional]: The person who is updating the record.
Name of this element in the application: History > Last Updated (By.)
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: The hp-service center server maintains this field.
Note: One should not try to populate/update this field. The hp-service center server maintains this field itself. In fact, one can't update/modify it (it's read only field.) However, one can use this field during retrieving.
IMTicket-status[Optional]: The status of incident management ticket (the incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Same as value given to <i-m-ticket-status> element.
Note: One can't populate/modify this directly. However, one can populate/modify this field by providing the value in the <i-m-ticket-status> element. Note, one can use this field during retrieving.
Subcategory [Required]: The subcategory of the selected category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Subcategory.
Valid Values: For every <category> there are several <subcategory> and for every <subcategory> there are several <product-type> and for every <product-type> there are several <problem-type> elements values.
For testing purpose one may use following- category: telecoms subcategory: fixed infrastructure product-type: fixed infrastructure problem-type: none
Default Value: No default value, as it's required element.
SLAAgreement-i-d[Optional]: The SLA Agreement ID of incident management ticket (the incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value: Same as value given to <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> element.
Note: One can't populate/modify this directly. However, one can populate/modify this field by providing the value in the <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> element. Note, one can use this field during retrieving.
Site-category [Required]: The site Category of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Site Category.
Valid Values: A, B, C, D, Remote
A -> Critical Site, B -> Major Site, C -> Satellite Site, D -> Home Site, Remote -> Remote.
Default Value: No default value, as this field is required one.
Product-type[Required]: The product type.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Product Type.
Valid Values: For every <category> there are several <subcategory> and for every <subcategory> there are several <product-type> and for every <product-type> there are several <problem-type> elements values.
For testing purpose one may use following- category: telecoms subcategory: fixed infrastructure product-type: fixed infrastructure problem-type: none
Default Value: No default value, as it's a required element.
problem-type [Required]: The problem type.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Problem Type.
Valid Values: For every <category> there are several <subcategory> and for every <subcategory> there are several <product-type> and for every <product-type> there are several <problem-type> elements values.
For testing purpose one may use following- category: telecoms subcategory: fixed infrastructure product-type: fixed infrastructure problem-type: none
Default Value: No default value, as it's required field.
Resolution-fix-type [Optional]: The resolution fixed type.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
user-priority [Optional]: The priority given by the user (for own referencing) while opening the ticket.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
solution [Optional]: The solution's description.
Note, It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of solution field (expected scenario.)
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
initial-impact [Required]: the initial impact of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Incident Details > Initial Impact Assessment.
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4 1 -> Enterprise, 2 -> Site/Dept, 3 -> Multiple User, 4 -> User.
Default Value: No default values, as it's required element.
S-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]: The ID of SLA agreement.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: "".
I-m-ticket-status [Optional]: the status of the ticket (incident.)
Name of this element in the application: Ticket Status.
Valid Values: Open Pending other work in progress Reject Resolved Pending vendor Closed Pending customer Referred Replaced Problem
Or, you can take your own string. For example “MyRandomString”. Ideally, this facility should not be there because on the hp-service-center client user interface application it is showing to be 'anum' type of field and thus should take some specific values only.
Default Value: Open.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <request-data> <hp-service-center-request> <xsl:if test="string('${username}') != ''"> <username>${username}</username> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string('${password}') != ''"> <password>${password}</password> </xsl:if> <entity> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">incident</xsl:text> </entity> <entity-type> <xsl:copy-of select="(//entity-type)[1]/text()" /> </entity-type> <request> <operation-name> <xsl:copy-of select="(//operation-name)[1]/text()" /> </operation-name> <xsl:for-each select="/items/item"> <parameters> <xsl:element name="${request element}"> <xsl:copy-of select="./model" /> </xsl:element> </parameters> </xsl:for-each> </request> </hp-service-center-request> </request-data> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
Create Incident
This wrapper creates 'Incident' record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
